analysis.summary: Tech headlines focus on Google's potential changes to UK search, Tesla's robotaxi launches in Texas, and advancements in AI and technology such as a revolutionary telescope and DNA editing. Business news covers oil price fluctuations due to geopolitical events, new product releases like the Raleigh One e-bike and Yale's Google Home smart lock, and tech company updates including Tesla's robotaxi rides facing initial challenges.
trending_topics: Business and product launches (e-bike, smart lock, Samsung event)

raw_headlines.title: Google may be forced to make changes to UK search
raw_headlines.summary: The Competition and Markets Authority says it wants to open up the UK search market.

raw_headlines.title: Tesla robotaxi 'low-key' launch in Texas
raw_headlines.summary: Tesla hopes to rival firms already offering driverless ride-hailing in the US and around the world, such as Waymo, Zoox and Baidu.

raw_headlines.title: First celestial image unveiled from revolutionary telescope
raw_headlines.summary: The telescope should detect killer asteroids and may even find the ninth planet in our solar system.

raw_headlines.title: Oil prices tumble after Israel agrees to Iran ceasefire
raw_headlines.summary: Crude has dropped by more than 5% with prices now below the level when Israel first launched its attack.

raw_headlines.title: Google introduces AI mode to users in India
raw_headlines.summary: Google introduced its AI mode, a Q&A-style search tool, to users in India today. The company said that this tool is still in the experimental stage and users will need to opt in to it through Search Labs. Once a user has opted in, they can ask queries in English. raw_headlines.title: Court filings reveal OpenAI and io’s early work on an AI device
raw_headlines.summary: The ChatGPT maker seems to be more than a year out from selling its first hardware device, which may not be an in-ear product whatsoever. Given what the company said in this lawsuit, it appears it is also exploring other form factors.

raw_headlines.title: Tesla’s robotaxis have already caught the attention of federal safety regulators
raw_headlines.summary: The U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) contacted Tesla after numerous videos posted online appear to show Tesla robotaxis violating traffic laws in South Austin, where the company is providing rides to invited customers.

raw_headlines.title: Researchers get viable mice by editing DNA from two sperm
raw_headlines.summary: Altering chemical modifications of DNA lets the DNA from two sperm make a mouse.

raw_headlines.title: With 1.2.2 update, Civilization VII tries to win back traditionalists
raw_headlines.summary: Players can now disable Legacy Paths, Crisis, and quite a bit more.

raw_headlines.title: Ted Cruz can’t get all Republicans to back his fight against state AI laws
raw_headlines.summary: Cruz plan moves ahead but was reportedly watered down amid Republican opposition.

raw_headlines.summary: The Raleigh One e-bike is now official after The Verge first published details of it last week. raw_headlines.summary: Thanks to a related trademark lawsuit, we know what OpenAI and Jony Ive's first AI device won't be. raw_headlines.title: Yale’s new Google Home smart lock is here — but it costs more thanks to tariffs
raw_headlines.summary: The Yale Smart Lock with Matter is launching tomorrow, June 24th, for $189.99 — $20 more than when it was first announced in March.
